Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; ENGRAVED; FAYENCE; ENGRAVED
Name: Shabti of Kanefer
Description: This shabti in green enamelled frit belongs to a certain Kanefer. During his life, he exercised the function of "Scribe of the temple of Ptah". His tomb was discovered in 1949 at Saqqara. The statuette carries as do the majority of shabtis of the Late Period Chapter 6 of the Book of the Dead.
